intro: Tilia croizatii, commonly known as the Croizat's lime, is a deciduous tree native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Tiliaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. The tree produces small, round fruits that contain three to four seeds. It typically grows in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone areas. Due to its ornamental value and historical significance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
